author: Harry MacElhone
description: Classically an equal parts three-ingredient cocktail comprising: 30ml rye, 30ml bitter liqueur and 30 ml dry vermouth. This produces an overly dry bittersweet spirituous drink. Hence, I prefer the Old Pal with an even split of dry and bianco vermouths so introducing a fourth ingredient and the merest touch more sweetness to tame this Negroni-style sipper.
name: Old Pal
recipeIngredient: 30 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof / 50% alc./vol.)

recipeInstructions.text: STIR all ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass
